results.headline: A Secret Life in Zurich
results.summary_short: Stefan Haupt’s “The Circle” tells the story of a gay Swiss couple, from their (dramatized) meeting in the 1950s to documentary interviews today.

results.headline: Smoldering Dance, Unadorned
results.summary_short: “Flamenco Flamenco,” by Carlos Saura, presents performances by some of the great ones of the field.

results.headline: Chapter 6 Has Great Advice for Gangsters
results.summary_short: A self-help guide affects a large ensemble of characters in “Reach Me,” set in the greater Los Angeles area.

results.headline: A Holy Man in India, Descended From New York Fashion
results.summary_short: Nicholas Vreeland, a grandson of the fashion editor Diana Vreeland and the leader of a Buddhist monastery in India, is profiled in “Monk With a Camera.”
results.display_title: Monk With A Camera: The Life and Journey of Nicholas Vreeland

results.headline: Get Off My Lawn, Werewolf
results.summary_short: In “Late Phases,” Nick Damici stars as a blind Vietnam veteran taking on a retirement village’s supernatural foe.

results.headline: In for a Penny, in for a Pound, and Better Work Conditions
results.summary_short: “Food Chains” is a documentary of a labor struggle waged by workers who each bring hundreds of pounds of tomatoes to market each day.

results.headline: Close Encounters of the Woodsy, Slasher Kind
results.summary_short: Directed by Colin Minihan, “Extraterrestrial” draws on themes and bits from other films for its tale of malevolent aliens.

results.headline: Making Music, Not War
results.summary_short: The spoils of war in Angola were hardly treasures: just more poverty and rubble, but the people still found inspiration for a national concert, chronicled in “Death Metal Angola.”

results.headline: Another Kind of Mystery Date
results.summary_short: Having two relationships at once causes complications for a graduate student in the comedy “All Relative.”

results.headline: An Orientation in Several Shades
results.summary_short: “4 Moons” is Sergio Tovar Velarde’s look at gay boys and men in today’s Mexico.

results.headline: A Redesign of Dracula’s Cape
results.summary_short: A Persian-speaking, chador-wearing vampire is the main character in Ana Lily Amirpour’s “A Girl Walks Home Alone at Night.”

results.headline: Legendary Seducers, Meeting in the Twilight
results.summary_short: In “Story of My Death,” the director and writer Albert Serra imagines the paths crossing of the hedonistic Casanova and a bloodthirsty Dracula.

results.headline: A Power Struggle, Roots and All
results.summary_short: In “Bad Hair,” a Venezuelan boy’s ideas about his appearance add to his mother’s troubles.

results.headline: Fanfare for the Common Man (and a Band)
results.summary_short: “Pulp: A Film About Life, Death & Supermarkets” is a documentary that returns to Sheffield, England, hometown of that alternative rock band, which had its heyday in the 1990s.

results.headline: Tarnished Halos at Penn State
results.summary_short: Joe Paterno, college football and the world of State College, Pa., home to Penn State, are examined in “Happy Valley,” a documentary built around the Jerry Sandusky child abuse case.

results.headline: Conditioned to Destroy, but Then a Softening
results.summary_short: In “Kill Dil,” set in India, a woman steps into the lives of two men raised to be killers.

results.headline: Plain on the Plains
results.summary_short: In “The Homesman,” Hilary Swank and Tommy Lee Jones help three women driven to madness by the frontier get back East.

results.headline: Taken Down by Twisted Ambition
results.summary_short: Starring Steve Carell and Channing Tatum, “Foxcatcher,” directed by Bennett Miller, tells the true-crime story of an Olympic wrestler and his multimillionaire sponsor.

results.headline: Just After Lake Placid, Things Improved
results.summary_short: Gabe Polsky’s documentary, “Red Army,” follows Soviet hockey stars from Olympic glory days to a second act with the National Hockey League.

results.headline: Cruising for Fares, a Song in His Heart
results.summary_short: The Serbian film “Love Hunter” centers on an ambitious Serbian musician trying to succeed in New York while making ends meet as a cabdriver.
